alert.note: Alert for Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 8:58PM EDT until July 15 at 12:00AM EDT by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Newport/Morehead City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Pitt County in eastern North Carolina... * Until midnight EDT. * At 858 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 1.5 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding may be already occurring, or will begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greenville, Winterville, Ayden, Dowdy Ficklen Stadium, East Carolina University and Pitt Greenville Airport. Very heavy rain rates will quickly overwhelm local drainage and lead to flooding of roadways and low lying areas. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1.5-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
